profileText: a Representative from California; born in San Mateo County, Calif., June 15, 1970; graduated from Junipero Serra High School, San Mateo, Calif., 1988; B.A., University of San Francisco, San Francisco, Calif., 1992; M.P.A., San Francisco State University, San Francisco, Calif., 1998; entrepreneur; staff, California state senator Karen Lorraine Jacqueline (Jackie) Speier, 1998-2001; member of the South San Francisco, Calif., city council, 2007-2012; Mayor of South San Francisco, Calif., 2010-2011; commissioner, Calif. Metropolitan Transportation Commission, 2011-2012; member of the California state assembly, 2012-2022, speaker pro tempore, 2014-2022; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress (January 3, 2023-present).
